meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.enactingFormula: (Made by the Secretary for Security under section 6A of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115))

section.name: s1
section.heading: Commencement
section.content: This Regulation comes into operation on a day to be appointed by the Secretary for Security by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: aircraft information (飛機資料), in relation to a traveller of an aircraft, means the information specified in section 5(3) relating to the aircraft;
designated system (指定系統) means any system or means designated by the Director under section 8;
direction (指示) means a direction issued by the Director under section 6;
Hong Kong Identity Card (香港身分證) means an identity card as defined by section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);

Mainland Travel Permit for Hong Kong and Macao Residents (港澳居民來往內地通行證) means a travel permit issued by the Central People’s Government of the People’s Republic of China to its holder for the purpose of travelling to and from the Mainland;
specified travel document (指明旅行證件) means—(a)a valid travel document;(b)a Hong Kong Identity Card; or(c)a Mainland Travel Permit for Hong Kong and Macao Residents;
traveller (旅客) means a passenger or a member of the crew of an aircraft.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Regulation applies to a civil aircraft that carries a traveller who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to land in Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to transit through Hong Kong and land in a place outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Exemptions
section.content: The Director may, by notice in writing, exempt an operator of an aircraft from any of the requirements of this Regulation in respect of the aircraft or a traveller of the aircraft by reason of an emergency, accident, or any other special circumstances.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Advance Passenger Information and Boarding Directions

section.name: s5
section.heading: Supply of API data and aircraft information etc. through designated system

subsection.leadIn: The operator of an aircraft must, no later than the time specified in section 7, supply to the Director through a designated system—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the API data relating to each of the passengers of the aircraft together with the aircraft information simultaneously; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the API data relating to each of the members of the crew of the aircraft together with the aircraft information simultaneously.

subsection.leadIn: The operator of the aircraft must, after the departure of the aircraft from the last port of embarkation but within the time specified in section 7, supply to the Director through a designated system a consolidated list of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the API data relating to all passengers on board the aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the API data relating to all members of the crew on board the aircraft; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total number of passengers and members of the crew on board the aircraft.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the flight number of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scheduled date and time of departure of the aircraft from the last port of embarkation to Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the scheduled date and time of arrival of the aircraft in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the last port of embarkation before the aircraft arrives in Hong Kong.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Operator of aircraft to comply with Director’s directions

subsection.leadIn: On receipt of the API data relating to a traveller of an aircraft together with the aircraft information under section 5(1), the Director must, as soon as possible but no later than the time of departure of the aircraft, issue either one of the following directions in relation to the traveller to the operator of the aircraft through a designated system—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a direction that the traveller is allowed to board the aircraft (known as “board direction”);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a direction that the traveller is not allowed to board the aircraft (known as “no-board direction”).

subsection.content: The operator of the aircraft must not allow a traveller to board the aircraft unless a board direction has been issued in relation to the traveller to the operator.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Specified time for supplying API data and aircraft information etc.

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of section 5(1)(a) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an aircraft (except a helicopter)—40 minutes before the time of its departure for Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a helicopter—10 minutes before the time of its departure for Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of section 5(1)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an aircraft (except a helicopter)—60 minutes before the time of its departure for Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a helicopter—60 minutes before the time of its departure for Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of section 5(2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an aircraft (except a helicopter)—30 minutes after the time of its departure for Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a helicopter—10 minutes after the time of its departure for Hong Kong.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Designation of Systems and Refusal of Entry

section.name: s8
section.heading: Director is to designate systems
section.leadIn: The Director must designate at least one system or means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the transmission and collection of the data and information under section 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the issuance of a direction.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Board direction does not validate invalid specified travel document
section.content: To avoid doubt, if a specified travel document held by a traveller of an aircraft is invalid, a board direction issued in relation to the traveller under section 6(1)(a) does not validate the travel document.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Immigration officer has power to refuse entry

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a board direction issued in relation to a traveller under section 6(1)(a) does not constitute a permission for the traveller to land or remain in Hong Kong under section 11(1) or (1A) of the Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an immigration officer may refuse to give permission for the traveller to land or remain in Hong Kong under section 11(1) or (1A) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s11
section.heading: No obligation to give reasons for no-board direction
section.content: The Director is not obliged to give any reason for his or her decision to issue a no-board direction in relation to a traveller under section 6(1)(b).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Failure to supply API data or aircraft information etc.

subsection.content: If section 5(1) or (2) is contravened, the operator of the aircraft concerned commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Supply of misleading or inaccurate API data or aircraft information etc.

subsection.content: The operator of an aircraft must ensure that the data or information supplied to the Director under section 5(1) or (2) is not misleading or inaccurate in a material particular.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Failure to act in accordance with directions issued by Director

subsection.content: If section 6(2) is contravened, the operator of the aircraft concerned commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Act done or omission made outside Hong Kong
section.content: For the purposes of sections 12, 13 and 14, an alleged act done or omission that is made in relation to the contravention as specified in those sections includes the act done or omission that is made, wholly or partly, outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 12, 13 or 14 to establish that, at the time of the alleged offence, the person had reasonable excuse for the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: A person is taken to have established the reasonable excuse for the contravention if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the reasonable excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Service of documents
section.leadIn: If the operator of an aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has neither a registered office nor a place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has appointed an agent who has a place of business in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: any documents required to be served on the operator in relation to a proceeding for an offence under section 12, 13 or 14 may be served on the agent at its place of business in Hong Kong, and the service on the agent is taken to be service of the documents on the operator.
